description: wood, A-frame structure; 2 vertical gaps filled with pennies; pennies attached to one side; Hebrew letters formed with paper money on the opposite side
text: "The construction of this tzedakah box plays on the interrelated nature of tzedakah, community, and money.  By using money as a central visual and structural element of the box, I wanted to demonstrate how money permeates the charitable community infrastructure.  Money used as tzedakah becomes a righteous mortar that holds our community institutions together.  Tzedakah transforms and elevates money to a higher moral plane beyond commerce.  The pennies are inseparable from the walnut elements, which symbolize community."  Phil Rosenbloom
title: Tzedakah Box (In God We Trust)
